name: Sourdough Flatbread
author: Rachel CM
summary: I created this flatbread recipe when I ran out of yeast. The sourdough starter gives it a sharp taste, almost like cheese crackers. It's great for appetizers like bruschetta.
ingredients: 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour, or as needed
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix 2 cups of flour and salt together in a large mixing bowl
Add sourdough starter, egg, and vegetable oil
Dough should not be very sticky; if it comes out sticky, add more flour as needed, until it reaches a consistency that can be easily kneaded
Knead dough until smooth, 5 to 8 minutes
Roll dough out until it is fairly thin, roughly 1/4 inch
Place dough on the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 30 minutes
